senses.sense_definition: To burn longer or more intensely than something else.

examples.text: The dense oak logs will <w>outburn</w> the softer pine wood by several hours.
Her passion and dedication seemed to <w>outburn</w> that of all her competitors.

senses.sense_definition: To be completely destroyed or consumed by fire.

examples.text: The small candle finally <w>outburned</w>, leaving the room in total darkness.
Dry leaves <w>outburn</w> quickly when thrown into a roaring campfire.
